other_tests.procedure_name: ERCP with biopsy and biliary stent placement
other_tests.findings: Common bile duct was cannulated and stented with a plastic stent. Biopsies and brushings were taken, which showed a well-differentiated neuroendocrine tumor.
3.6 cm ill-defined arterially hypo-enhancing lesion at the pancreaticoduodenal groove concerning for cancer. Note of lymph node involvement including a 5-cm necrotic common hepatic lymph node.

Common bile duct is dilated in the region of the porta hepatis measuring approximately 7 mm. A stent is identified in the common bile duct. A 3.4 x 3.3 x 2.5 cm hypoechoic mass corresponding to a necrotic lymph node.
